item.title: Course Overview
item.description: Course Overview # Important CSE students should note that CS 7641 is not allowed as a substitute for the CSE core course CSE 6740, and that they cannot get credit for both CSE 6740 and CS 7641. This course introduces techniques in machine learning with an emphasis on algorithms and their applications to real-world data. We will investigate the following question: how to computationally extract useful knowledge from data for decision making and task support!

item.title: Instructor and TAs

item.title: Course Schedule
item.description: Schedule # Important All deadline and due dates in this course will be at 23:59 ET. Scroll horizontally to see the full schedule table on mobile devices Astericks (*) indicate that the lecture slides/notes are available. Week Dates Topics Homework Quizzes Project Readings 1 5/15 - 5/19 *Course Overview (L1) *Linear Algebra (*Notes, L2) Q0 - L1 | Q1 - L2 GT Honor Code; Heilmeier catechism; Visual Information Theory by Chris Olah; GitHub Pages; YAML Configuration; Overleaf for GT students; Linear Algebra Review by Zico Kolter; 2 5/22 - 5/26 *Prob and Stats (*Notes, L3) *Info Theory (*Notes, L4) A1 out 5/22 Q2 - L3 | Q3 - L4 | Syllabus Quiz Project team composition due 5/26 Independence, Coorelation, Orthogonality Correlation vs Covariance; The Differences Between Data, Information and Knowledge Cross Entropy as loss function More about Cross Entropy and KLD; Probability Theory Review by Andrew Moore; 3 5/29 - 6/2 Memorial Day Holiday *Optimization (L5) *Toolbox - P1/P2 (L5) Q4 - L5 [Debugging Common Errors in NumPy](/other/Debugging Common Errors in NumPy.
